contents.p: The sarcophagus of Psamtik-Seneb (CMA 71.2254) (Harrison 2007) was excavated by Henri Gaulthier at Heliopolis in 1931 (Gauthier 1933). The sarcophagus was found looted, with basin intact but the cover broken into a number of pieces. Both are decorated and inscribed with funerary texts. The piece eventually entered the art market and was restored at least twice after excavation. It was purchased at auction by Walter P. Chrysler in 1971 and subsequently gifted to the Chrysler Museum of Art in Norfolk, VA.

Psamtik-Seneb himself is not yet known from other records. Although the inscriptions are transcribed in the original archeological publication, initial transliterations and translation were made of the basin texts by James Allen (Allen 1987). A complete translation of all the texts is presented publicly here for the first time. Psamtik-Seneb lived during the 26th Dynasty. He worked as a type of physician and ritualist who provided charms to prevent injury by scorpions and other venomous creatures and treated the wounds of those stung or bitten. His title is Scorpion Controller (xrp-sA-srq.t) in Egyptian. The sarcophagus is stylistically very similar to a number of 26th Dynasty sarcophagi found at Giza, Saqqara, and Heliopolis. Two comparable examples are the sarcophagi of Psamtik at the Phoebe A. Hearst Museum of Anthropology in Berkeley, CA and of Pakap at the British Museum, London. They were found in Saqqara and Giza, respectively, and are inscribed with similar texts as Psamtik-Seneb’s sarcophagus (Patanè 1992, von Falck 2001, Altmann-Wendling, Baumann et al. 2018).

text.desc: Cover central RtoL col a and col b
text.al: [x]a xrp-sA-srq.t psmTk-snb m [n]fr-tm m sSn r S(r.t)i ra pr=f m Ax.t wab nTr.w n mAA=f
text.tr: The Scorpion Controller Psamtik-Seneb appears as Nefertum in the lotus at the nose of Ra when he emerges in the Akhet, that the gods become pure at seeing him.

text.desc: Cover RtoL col c and col d
text.al: Ax[.w r]di{t}.n inpw m-[H?]r? sA qrs.t n.t wsir iw=sn [m sA qrs.t] n.t wsir xrp-sA-srq.t psmTk-snb mAa-xrw
text.tr: The Akhu Spirits Anubis has placed as (lit. over) protection of the sarcophagus of Osiris, that they be protection of the Sarcophagus of the Osiris Scorpion Controller Psamtik-Seneb, justified.

text.desc: Cover LtoR col e and col f
text.al: Ax.w rdi{t}.n inpw m sA qrs.t n.t wsir [i]w=s[n] m sA qrs.t n.t wsir xrp-sA-srq.t psmTk-snb mAa-xrw
text.tr: The Akhu Spirits Anubis has placed as protection of the sarcophagus of Osiris, that they be protection of the Sarcophagus of the Osiris Scorpion Controller Psamtik-Seneb, justified.

text.desc: Cover Vignette column - Mummy Right RtoL vigcol 1 Texts 3, 5, 7, 9
text.hi: PF4-|vig col 1a-Aa14-s#134-#b-..-.-#e-! PF4-|vig col 1b-#b-..-..-#e-f#24-! PF4-|vig col 1c-U1-D4-G1-I9-! PF4-|vig col 1d-#b-..-..-.-#e-!

text.desc: Cover Vignette column - Mummy Left LtoR vigcol 2 Texts 4, 6, 8, 10
text.hi: PF5-|vig col 2a-H-Aa5A\69**p{{331,272,69}}-! PF5-|vig col 2b-W15-sn-sn-sn-f-! PF5-|vig col 2c-#b-..-..-.-#e-! PF5-|vig col 2d-#b-..-..-.-#e-!

text.desc: Basin - Horizontal, Mummy Right, L to R, Bandeau inscription
text.al: Dd-mdw i(i) n=k zA=k Hr nD.n=f Tw xrp-sA-srq.t psmTk-snb mAa-xrw aHa r.k Tz Tw ms.n Tw mw.t=k nw.t im(i)=k gAw im(i)=k aS aHa=k xnti nTr.w
text.tr: Words spoken: Your son Horus has come. He has saved you, Scorpion Controller Psamtik-Seneb, true of voice. So stand up! Raise yourself! Your mother Nut has given birth to you. You will not suffer want. You will not groan. You will stand at the front of the gods.

text.desc: Basin - Horizontal, Mummy Left, R to L, Bandeau inscription
text.al: Dd-mdw i(i).n Hr m sxnw=k xrp-sA-srq.t psmTk-snb mAa xrw Tz Tw rs Tw tp=k r Ax.t pr=k r (p).t ms.<ti>{Tw} m nw.t anx.<ti>{Tw} m-m sbA.w
text.tr: Words spoken: It is in your embrace that Horus has come, Scorpion Controller Psamtik-seneb, true of voice. Raise yourself up! Lift up your head toward the horizon, so that you may go forth to heaven! May you be born in Nut (sc. the sky). May you live among the stars.
